item.description:
Global Entrepreneurship Week at Northeastern University:
16-20 November 2009
http://www.northeaste...
*PLEASE NOTE LOCATION CHANGE*
108 West Village G (450 Parker Street)


November 17, 2009
Digital Media & Gaming: Making Your Name in a Changing Game Industry

The EntreTech event will feature a lively and interactive discussion between panelists and the audience on how young entrepreneurs and their start-ups can be successful in today’s changing gaming industry. The panelists bring a wide range of experiences as developers, entrepreneurs, and executives from the industry’s premier companies. They will discuss international competition, getting funded, publishing your games, changing gaming platforms, and the strategies that will help you make your name in this dynamic industry.

Moderator:
Terrence Masson, Director Of Creative Industries, Northeastern University

Panelists:
Brian Sullivan, Co-founder Iron Lore Entertainment and Ensemble Studios

Eitan Glinert, President, Fire Hose Games

Paul Neurath, Founder & Creative Director, Floodgate Entertainment

Al Reed, Co-Founder and Studio Director, Demiurge Studios

Meeting Cost:
$25 public, $10 students and active military;

Pre-Registration



The Future of Video Game Input: Muscle Sensors:
http://www.livescienc...
item.name: Digital Media & Gaming (during Global Entrepreneurship Week Northeastern U)
